class gaia::core::Delegate

Detailed Description

This class provide methods for Notification handle.

The Notification class provides methods for create a new notification.

The following example demonstrates how to use the Notification 

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstenceState) {

  Context* context = new Context(this);

  //new Notification
  mN = new Notification();
  const String* string = new String("test");
  Demand* demand = new Demand();
  demand->setClassName(*context_t, *string);
  PendingDemand* pendingDemand = PendingDemand::getPageN(*context_t, *demand, 0);
  mN->setDefaults(1);
  mN->setIcon(0x7f020001);//com::gaia::android::psclient::R::drawable::usb_to_pc_notify;
  mN->setFlags(gaia::service::Notification::FLAG_ONGOING_EVENT);
  mN->setTickerText(new String("Test");//title;
  mN->setWhen(0);
  setContentTitle(contentTitle);
  setContentText(contentText);
  setContentDemand(contentDemand);
  combineNotification(context);
 }

Definition at line 65 of file Notification.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
Enumerator:
JOG_OFF 

Jog off.

JOG_SHORT_FLASH 

Jog flash short.

JOG_BREATHING 

Jog breathing.

DEFAULT_ALL 

Use all default values (where applicable).

DEFAULT_SOUND 

Use the default notification sound.

This will ignore any given.

DEFAULT_VIBRATE 

Use the default notification vibrate.

This will ignore any given. vibrate. Using phone vibration requires the permission.

DEFAULT_LIGHTS 

Use the default notification lights.

This will ignore the FLAG_SHOW_LIGHTS bit, and ledARGB, ledOffMS or ldeOnMS.

FLAG_SHOW_LIGHTS 

Bit to be bitwise-ored into the flags field that should be set if you want the LED on for this notification.

To turn the LED off, pass 0 in the alpha channel for colorARGB or 0 for both ledOnMS and ledOffMS. To turn the LED on, pass 1 for ledOnMS and 0 for ledOffMS. To flash the LED, pass the number of milliseconds that it should be on and off to ledOnMS and ledOffMS. Since hardware varies, you are not guaranteed that any of the values you pass are honored exactly. Use the system defaults (TODO) if possible because they will be set to values that work on any given hardware.

STREAM_DEFAULT 

Use this constant as the value for audioStreamType to request that the default stream type for notifications be used.

Currently the default stream type is STREAM_RING.

FLAG_ONGOING_EVENT 

Bit to be bitwise-ored into the flags field that should be set if this notification is in reference to something that is ongoing, like a phone call.

It should not be set if this notification is in reference to something that happened at a particular point in time, like a missed phone call.

FLAG_INSISTENT 

Bit to be bitwise-ored into the flags field that if set, the audio will be repeated until the notification is cancelled or the notification window is opened.

FLAG_ONLY_ALERT_ONCE 

Bit to be bitwise-ored into the flags field that should be set if you want the sound and/or vibration play each time the notification is sent, even if it has not been canceled before that.

FLAG_AUTO_CANCEL 

Bit to be bitwise-ored into the flags field that should be set if the notification should be canceled when it is clicked by the user.

FLAG_NO_CLEAR 

Bit to be bitwise-ored into the flags field that should be set if the notification should not be canceled when the user clicks the Clear all button.

FLAG_FOREGROUND_SERVICE 

Bit to be bitwise-ored into the flags field that should be set if this notification represents a currently running service.

This will normally be set for you by Service startForeground

LAG_HIGH_PRIORITY 

Bit to be bitwise-ored into the flags field that should be set if this notification represents a high-priority event that may be shown to the user even if notifications are otherwise unavailable (that is, when the status bar is hidden).

This flag is ideally used in conjunction with fullScreenIntent.

FLAG_SHOW_JOGS 

the Flag of show Jogs.

FLAG_ONTOP_EVENT 

the Flag of Ontop Event.

FLAG_MUSIC_EVENT 

the Flag of Music Event.

FLAG_DLNA_MUSIC_EVENT 

the Flag of DLNA Music Event.

FLAG_DLNA_GALLERY_EVENT 

the Flag of DLNA Gallery Event.

FLAG_CALL_FORWARD_EVENT 

the Flag of Call Forward Event.

FLAG_MSG_FORWARD_EVENT 

the Flag of MSG Forward Event.

void gaia::service::Notification::setAutoCancel ( bool  autoCancel)

Setting this flag will make it so the notification is automatically canceled when the user clicks it in the panel.

The PendingDemand set with setDeleteDemand will be broadcast when the notification is canceled.

Parameters:
autoCancelAuto cancel or not.
void gaia::service::Notification::setBigContent ( gaia::ui::RemoteWidget *  bigRemoteWidget)

A large-format version of contentView, giving the Notification an opportunity to show more detail.

The system UI may choose to show this instead of the normal content view at its discretion.

void gaia::service::Notification::setFullScreenDemand ( const gaia::core::PendingDemand &  demand,
bool  highPriority 
)

An intent to launch instead of posting the notification to the status bar.

Only for use with extremely high-priority notifications demanding the user's immediate attention, such as an incoming phone call or alarm clock that the user has explicitly set to a particular time. If this facility is used for something else, please give the user an option to turn it off and use a normal notification, as this can be extremely disruptive.

Parameters:
demandThe pending demand to launch.
highPriorityPassing true will cause this notification to be sent even if other notifications are suppressed. Set the Small Icon id of a drawer to use as the icon in the status bar.
iconThe resource id in the application's package of the drawble to use.

linesThe lines Number of this Inbox style notification, no more than 8.

void gaia::service::Notification::setNumber ( int32_t  number)

Set the number of events that this notification represents.

For example, if this is the. new mail notification, this would be the number of unread messages. This number is be superimposed over the icon in the status bar. If the number is 0 or negative, it is not shown in the status bar

Parameters:
numberThe number of events that this notification represents.
void gaia::service::Notification::setOngoing ( bool  ongoing)

Set whether this is an ongoing notification.

Ongoing notifications differ from regular notifications in the following ways: Ongoing notifications are sorted above the regular notifications in the notification panel. Ongoing notifications do not have an 'x' close button, and are not affected by the "Clear all" button.

Parameters:
ongoingonGoing notification or not.
void gaia::service::Notification::setOnlyAlertOnce ( bool  onlyAlertOnce)

Set this flag if you would only like the sound, vibrate and ticker to be played if the notification is not already showing.

Parameters:
onlyAlertOnceOnly alert once or not.

void gaia::service::Notification::setUsesChronometer ( bool  b)

Show the Notification#when field as a stopwatch.

Instead of presenting when as a timestamp, the notification will show an automatically updating display of the minutes and seconds since when. Useful when showing an elapsed time (like an ongoing phone call).

See also:
android.widget.Chronometer
Notification::when
